title: You want to know what's funny about Ryze?

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Ryze when played Top. Statistics include Ryze's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Ryze Top is Strong or Weak Against.

body:
Watching him fall.

Okay, I know the remake has just come out and people need time to adjust, but this is just bad comedy.
Last time we saw a win rate this low was when Bard was released, and this is League of Legends' mascot, the giant statue of whom stands in their office.

I'll give it a week, but I have to ask, what is the Balance Team on and how did they sneak it past security?

Edit: Down votes already it seems. Sadly some people can't laugh at the irony of Ryze falling and the humor that no one in plat+ ranked seems to know how to play his new kit even though there isn't any really crazy mechanics added.

Edit 2: I am still playing Ryze and getting to know his new kit and what works and what still needs work. Currently, my view is his kit is powerful, but a bit at odds with itself at times.

Edit 3: Tank Ryze seems to be dead sadly, with the reduced mana ratios, CDR being wasted on him, and more reliance on AP, I find he needs to take a more traditional burst mage build. His Q also needs some work, maybe have it pass through minions at a reduced damage since it get caught on them too much.
His targeted moves seem a little short on the range side and could use a slight range increase.

I honestly think people are underestimating how difficult management of his passive is, and how his game really pivots around that. You go from having 3 okay damage spells to as-many-as-you-can-cast-in-4/5/6-seconds number of spells, so long as you're comboing correctly. With old Ryze you had a few combos to memorize that you could use in pretty much any situation; because of how new Ryze's passive works, you have to adjust your combos on the fly depending on how many stacks of your passive you have and the timing of your attacks to really maximize his kit. Ryze's skill floor and skill ceiling have increased dramatically, the skillshot is really no big deal compared to his passive management.

EDIT: Additionally, there's the 0.25 second restriction on his passive mechanic; you actually have to slow down your combo in order to utilize the cooldown reduction. It's honestly kind of awkward; I can see why they have it in place (he would be absolutely ridiculous without it), but I feel like there's a better way, like shorten the time you have to actually use the combo but remove the restriction on his cooldowns so he can fully reset them, that way he feels more like the machine-gun Ryze and less like a semi-automatic Ryze.

Also, since Ryze now only gets 3-6 second windows of power, cc is devastating. If you get stunned or silenced during your passive, you are screwed. Because of this, I've found that the most reliable way to deal damage in lane is R>W>E, not worrying about your passive. This of course, only works if your opponent is standing in the middle of their wave. 

Right now I think he suffers from an identity crisis: He is less effective as a tanky AP bruiser because his ratios have been nerfed and CDR is a wasted stat on him, he doesn't make a great assassin because he doesn't have the burst or the utility to deliver his damage, he doesn't work as a sustained AP carry because his short range puts him in too much danger and his damage output isn't reliable. At this point, I'm just not sure what he is good at.

Here is my view on him after playing him several times and trying out new builds:

Most annoying thing that's lost me several kills and generally doesn't feel right is the cast times on his abilities.It's near impossible to chase somebody who has almost equal or greater movement speed.Casting E causes Ryze to stop for a moment while the enemy can get away.It's horrible.The same goes for casting Q and trying to "snipe".
I understand cast times are necessary but there is a point where it hampers smooth gameplay which happens in this case in my opinion.

- The range on _Overload_(Q) for a "mage" or i don't know what should i call Ryze now is simply not enough.It's not sufficient to for poking or farming from safe distance.950-1000 range would be more ideal for this spell.

- _Rune Prison_(W) is alright.

- As i mentioned the range on _Spell Flux_(E) should be looked at for a smoother gameplay or the cast time needs to be reduced.
Another problem i noticed is Ryze's farming ability compared to used mana and his efficiency at.Let's just say it's rather bad compared to other mids.
The problem comes from the inability to deal enough AoE damage with a single spell flux without active ulti.

- _Desperate Power_(R) is alright.

All in all there are annoying cast times on his abilities that either need to be reduced or range on spells should be increased.His ability to farm is not efficient at all without using ultimate.However you may say that i should have no problem with this as the ulti cooldown can be reduced via the passive however early-mid game the mana usage is so high that trying to reduce the cooldown on the ulti will deplete mana too fast.
So currently there is not much to do against mids who can push wave harder than Ryze.You simply can't interrupt their attempt to roam at all.If you try to push back though you will be out of mana EVERY time resulting in a lost lane because what can you do without mana on Ryze?

Also his itemization sucks.Frozen Heart even with 10% wasted CDR is still the best choice for a defensive item.Tear and RoA is mandatory which leaves us with 3 more big items.Count in FH as another mandatory item and with that we are down to 2 choices.
EDIT:His cast times are fucking awful.And the range on E doesn't help either.I am sorry Riot but currently he isn't good.

I've played Ryze a lot since the rework, and I think it's just the frequent move of releasing a champ under-tuned because it is more healthy to have a champ too weak than too strong and they will nudge him up little by little. I like the rework, but it definitely needs some changes. To my mind the big change is not his Q. This is a change, and it hurts the reliability of his damage, but that was kind of the point. The big changes are his passive and the nerfs to mana scaling. Utilizing that window of power on a champ with zero mobility is tricky against players who know what they are doing. The mana scaling nerfs and 30% CDR on his ulti make his itemization after RoA and Archangel's less clear too.
